div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1243 Karaman (anc. Laranda), Lycaonia, 1946 Burial: c. 400-390 B.C. (Robinson) Contents: 71+ AR Athens: 28 tetradr. Eastern imit. of Athens: 42 tetradr. Tissaphernes, Miletus: 1 tetradr. Disposition: London 50 Robinson, NC 1948, pp. 48-56, illus. Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 9, no. 13 The find spot is uncertain. According to another source the hd. was found near Konya (anc. Iconium, Lycaonia) c. 100 km. NW of Karaman, while Prof. Seyrig was informed that it came from Marash (anc. Antiocheia ad Taurum, Commagene) more than 300 km. to the E. According to Seyrig the mention of Karaman may be due to confusion with the following hd., no. 1244
